translation.en: Everyone's heard of the city that never sleeps.
translation.ja: 誰もが知る“眠らない街”

translation.en: What about the mothers who never sleep because their boys move to the city and never call?

translation.en: This is a story about three such mothers and their three sons.
translation.ja: これは そんな３人の母親と ３人の息子の物語

translation.en: Stop the cab!
Look where we are.
You guys are such profound assholes.
-It's time, Daniel. -All right, I know. I'm still deciding.

translation.en: -You decided, you got a ring. -Yes.
-You're getting engaged! -Yes.
-Right now? -Isn't that fantastic?
I'm not asking Erin to marry me tonight, drunk with girls in the car. No offense.

translation.en: -I mean, no, we're going to Matt's. -D, I love you, but get out.

translation.en: -Come on. -Bye.
Come on. Look...
You are happy with Erin.

translation.en: Like, happier than I've seen you since... sixth grade.

translation.en: -Horrible pep talk. -These are the facts.

translation.en: -Erin! -All right.
Baby! Erin!
This, by the way,
-is why we don't all hang out anymore. -Listen to me, okay?

translation.en: This will be romantic.
This is the story that she's gonna tell your kids.

translation.en: She's gonna say, "That's the night that he stormed up the stairs,

translation.en: and got down on one knee..." and you asked if she would marry you.

translation.en: That is novel material.
Novel material.
Ah, yeah. It would be a pretty great story.

translation.en: We were there for every big life event,

translation.en: and now we're lucky if we hear about anything at all.

translation.en: Erin!
Daniel?
What the fuck?
There's a lot you don't know as mothers.

translation.en: In fact, that's what bonded us
translation.ja: NETFLIX プレゼンツ その事実が 息子たちの 友情と共に始まった― その事実が 息子たちの 友情と共に始まった―

translation.en: when the boys' friendship launched our friendship
translation.ja: その事実が 息子たちの 友情と共に始まった―

translation.en: on a playground in Poughkeepsie.

translation.en: and at every scary and unfamiliar stage,

translation.en: the answer was always "friends".

Why are you teaching today?

It's a lie.

Hairstylist. And so what?

Remember the Brimers?

translation.en: On the corner. They had that horrible little Shih Tzu

translation.en: -that bit you when you were six. -I remember the dog.

translation.en: Well, Joan's sister has a nephew by marriage in Yonkers,

translation.en: and he gave me this number of this brilliant woman from his temple.

translation.en: She's just been through a painful divorce, which apparently was not her fault at all.

translation.en: Okay, good to know.
And she is a beautiful person.

translation.en: -you've never even met her, have you? -I saw her social media.

translation.en: She is smart. She did a beach clean-up.

translation.en: She's starting to think about dating again. We got to get in there fast.

translation.en: -She said she'd love to hear from you. -Why have you done this?

She graduated from Brown, she has a political science degree,

translation.en: who's somehow related to the woman whose dog bit me when I was a kid.

I'm not talking about the dog, Ma. I'm talking about your insanity.

translation.en: Good shot.
Have you had a date since you've lived here? I don't think this apartment is helping at all.

translation.en: Hi, is this Alison?
It's...
Daniel Lieberman.

translation.en: It's kind of great. It's sort of a group home for gays.

That's more shocking than your son coming out.

translation.en: Absolutely. How's Daniel?

translation.en: Yeah, I'm in a hotel, too.
What?
Yes, I know what I said, but, you know, Paul's got his plate full

translation.en: and doesn't need a house guest on top of it, you know?

translation.en: So, he forgot Mother's Day. Big deal.

translation.en: -Big deal? -Yeah.
What? You got me drunk and made me come here.

translation.en: But seriously... how do you live in this town and forget Mother's Day?

translation.en: Look. Mother, mom, mama, Mutter, madre, maman.

translation.en: This is Joseph.
Look at these cute bags. Let's go in.
No. Paul does Joseph. He did these windows.

translation.en: I am so moving in with that fucker.
Are you the famous writer?
Either my mom exaggerated, or you're meeting someone else.

translation.en: -I'm Alison. -Daniel.

translation.en: -Hello. -Hi.
You write for The New Yorker, that's pretty famous.

I thought your mom said you did write for The New Yorker.

-The Willacoochee River Journal. -No.

-You're making that up. -I wish I could make that up.

translation.en: My mom should talk less.
Yeah, but if your mom talked less, we wouldn't be here right now, so...

translation.en: you know, thank God for your mother, right?
Daniel!
If you're there and you're pretending you're not, I'm never talking to you again.

translation.en: Or maybe that's what you want.
Daniel!
What?
Oh, God, this is totally unsafe.
Oh, come on. Open?

translation.en: Mice!
So, you lived in New York?
Did I ever. I worked in fashion at the time. I met Paul's father at Studio 54.

translation.en: -No. -Yeah.
Fabulous.
Yes, and ridiculous. You're supposed to have sex

translation.en: with people you meet there, do drugs with them, not marry them.

so when he leaves for work, he won't have to wonder if I'll be here when he gets home.

Well, he never told me that.
Hey.
-Hey! -There he is.
Are you cooking?
Well, yeah.
I was falling out of love with him,

translation.en: but I thought I was falling out of love with myself. Know what I mean?

translation.en: No, not really.
Oh, okay.
Think of yourself as an egg.
-Okay, why? -Because the egg is you, okay?

translation.en: It's your self-love, your self-worth. You're the egg, right?

translation.en: but what happens when you press on the ends of an egg?
I don't know.

translation.en: But what does it take to turn good love into bad love?

No. The egg twists, okay? That's it.

translation.en: Now, suddenly, the pressure is on the sides of the egg.

translation.en: Oh, yeah.
Yes, Daniel. It breaks, all right.
So, who broke your egg, Daniel?

To bang your trainer?
Five weeks...
without a word.
I felt like you were happy for the chance to walk away.

all I ever wanted was you,
and for us to be together, and...
maybe we'll...
one day have children.

No.
Daniel.
Who broke your egg?
Okay, look... -Alison. -Yep.
I'm here to get rid of my mother,

-You don't have to. -You don't fix the egg.

translation.en: It doesn't matter who twisted it, it's broken.

translation.en: And you gotta let it go. And once you've truly bid that egg farewell, you'll...

translation.en: you'll find a new egg.

translation.en: Thank you.
That was...
I really need the check right now. I don't think I can hear about the egg anymore. I'm sorry.

translation.en: All right. I was gonna split the bill with you, but now I'm not so...

translation.en: thank you.
Fair. Good luck with your egg hunt.

All right, kiss her already.

Beautiful.
You just made my night.

translation.en: This has nothing to do with you coming out to me. It's just...

translation.en: but there is no you and him.
And I am not willing to be the you and the him,
